content.notes: Content not refactored in Phase 1; original preserved under payload.

payload.posterTitle: Asia: From Monsoon Green to Sky-High Cold

biomes.name: Socotra Island
biomes.description: Socotra is an isolated island with strange, ancient plants. Dragon’s blood trees and desert roses grow on rocky plateaus, making the landscape feel like a living science‑fiction world.

biomes.name: Western Ghats
biomes.description: India’s Western Ghats catch monsoon rains that feed forests, rivers, and waterfalls. These mountains shelter rich wildlife, from frogs and orchids to big mammals, across a long, green ridge.

biomes.name: Lut Desert
biomes.description: Iran’s Lut Desert is a land of intense heat and wind‑carved shapes. Giant dunes and yardang ridges stretch for miles, showing how wind and sun can sculpt the Earth.

biomes.name: Borneo Rainforest
biomes.description: Borneo’s rainforest is ancient and towering, with a thick canopy and steamy air. Orangutans, hornbills, and countless insects depend on this dense green world of rivers and trees.

biomes.name: Altai Mountains
biomes.description: The Altai Mountains span rugged peaks, clear lakes, and wide valleys across Central Asia. Snowy ridges, alpine meadows, and wild rivers make this a crossroads of cultures and wildlife.

biomes.name: Siberian Tundra
biomes.description: Siberia’s tundra is a treeless plain of moss, lichen, and permafrost. In the short summer, wildflowers bloom and migrating reindeer move across wetlands under long daylight.

biomes.name: Tibetan Plateau
biomes.description: The Tibetan Plateau is a vast highland above many clouds. Cold nights, thin air, and open grasslands shape life here, where yaks graze and distant peaks ring the horizon.
